notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Claudon
notable_quotes.french: que l'argent du diable estoit bon pour achepter des preys
notable_quotes.english: that the devil's money was good to buy meadows
notable_quotes.context: Hearsay testimony about conversation on devil's money

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Claudon
notable_quotes.french: advient qu'on commencea a parler de la devineresse du village de Bouray qui avoit esté executée pour le crime de sortillege, qu'un jour elle avoit receu de l'argent du diable, et que venant en son logis avoit trouvé que c'estoit des feuilles, ou fiente de chevaulx (soub corection) dequoy ledit prevenu respondit que c'estoit aussy bon argent de mise que de l'autre et que les officiers n'avoient garde de le dire en proces qu'il fust bon, par ce qu'un chacun le vouldroit estre
notable_quotes.english: they began to talk of the diviner from the village of Bouray who had been executed for the crime of sorcery, that one day she had received money from the devil, and that coming to her lodging had found that it was leaves, or horse dung (under correction) to which the accused responded that it was as good money to use as any other and that the officers were careful not to say in trial that it was good, because everyone would want to be [a witch]
notable_quotes.context: Conversation at mill about executed witch and devil's money

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Claudon
notable_quotes.french: qu'il avoit tousjours deux heures bonnes a la journée, pour mener et conduire son bestial aux champs pour faire dommage a aultruy, sans estre trouvé
notable_quotes.english: that he always had two good hours in the day, to lead and conduct his animals to the fields to do damage to others, without being found
notable_quotes.context: Testimony from 26 years earlier when courting Babelon

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Claudon
notable_quotes.french: que s'il avoit une riche femme espousée qu'il auroit beaucoup d'enfant, et sy elle estoit pauvre qu'elle en auroit bien peu
notable_quotes.english: that if he had married a rich woman he would have many children, and if she was poor she would have very few

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Claudon
notable_quotes.french: sy elle doubtoit qu'elle fust trop jeune pour avoir des enfants qu'il la garderoit bien qu'elle n'en auroit que deux, et sy c'estoit une autre qu'elle qu'il n'ayme pas qu'il n'en auroit qu'un, et en scavoit les remedes
notable_quotes.english: if she doubted that she was too young to have children, he would ensure that she would have only two, and if it was another that he didn't love she would have only one, and he knew the remedies
notable_quotes.context: Marriage proposal to Marguitte 18 years earlier

notable_quotes.speaker: Anthoine Andreu
notable_quotes.french: la mal envie, s'il failloit qu'il meure pour cela
notable_quotes.english: the evil envy, if it was necessary that he die for this
notable_quotes.context: Dying words of forester who replaced Nicolas Claudon

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Claudon
notable_quotes.french: qu'il craindoit bien qu'on luy feroit beaucoup de mal, et luy deposant respondit qu'il avoit usé de propos ilicites et malsonnantz et qu'il s'en eut bien garée, et il repliqua qu'il n'en avoit point usé qu'il puisse estre reprins
notable_quotes.english: that he feared greatly that they would do him much harm, and the witness replied that he had used illicit and ill-sounding words and that he should have guarded against them, and he replied that he had not used any for which he could be reproached
notable_quotes.context: Conversation day before Colas Chaudron testified

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Claudon (to judges)
notable_quotes.french: bien esbahy d'ou proviennent tant de propos, et qu'il n'eut jamais pensé d'estre ainsy chargé comme il est
notable_quotes.english: quite astonished where so many statements come from, and that he had never thought to be thus charged as he is
notable_quotes.context: Response during first interrogation when confronted with testimony

extraction_metadata.notes: Very complete trial record with 29 witnesses, detailed testimony, and full procedural timeline. Key patterns: (1) Very long reputation (up to 26 years) built primarily on suspicious conversations about devil's money and controlling fertility; (2) Multiple animal deaths following refusals to sell/exchange animals; (3) Accused claimed magical ability to prevent discovery while trespassing; (4) Economic tensions around forester position and property boundaries; (5) Mother also reputed witch; (6) Accused withstood initial torture (thumbscrews) but confessed under racking; (7) Retracted confession but renewed it immediately when threatened with second torture; (8) Confession relatively minimal - claimed to refuse devil's requests for harm, only tested powder once on pig; (9) Extensive hearsay testimony about devil's money conversations; (10) Multiple marriage rejections linked to reputation. Document at witness 5 notes damage. Economic status assessed as 'middling' based on: owned animals (calves, possibly horses), worked as laboureur, had position as forester, could afford to contemplate marriages with dowries, could earn living anywhere (his own statement), but also involved in minor theft (hay) and lost forester position.
